div.pre: 2118 Naro, 22 km. SE of Agrigento, 1925 (728) Burial: c. 390-85 B.C. (K) Contents: c. 88 AR Acragas: 2 decadr. Syracuse: 26 decadr. (to issues of Euainetos marked Î”) * Tetradrachms: c. 60 * Noe lists these as Syracusan, but Orsi specifies only condition (fdc), not mint Disposition: Lloyd 1 (SNG 817 = decadr. of Acragas); Gulbenkian (decadr. of Acragas and Syracuse) Orsi, AttiMemIIN 1932, p. 38 Bernhart, Numismatik 1932, p. 12, illus. (pp. 12, 34-5) A note in the ANS states that Lloyd purchased from this hd. "1 of the Agrigentine deka- drachms, 4 of the Syracusan dekadrachms, and all the 43 tetradrachms various"
